text: this is get eaten for the new york times
it's very nearly 2015 and using the new
year countdown up by time and date com
is a great way to count down to the hour
when midnight strikes all around the
world this free iOS app is very simple
it's simply a list of various places in
all the different time zones dotted
around the earth each time zone in the
list has its own countdown timer because
of course the Earth spins through
midnight and midnight doesn't happen
everywhere at the same time the apps
handy time zone map shows how this works
graphically it's basically a fun up to
use while you're waiting for bid night
to strike where you are New Year's Day
of course means new year's resolutions
and keeping fit as one of the most
popular ones many folks like to go
running or join a gym but I've had great
success using an app called breeze which
is free on iOS basically the apps are
smart pedometer it counts the number of
steps you make throughout the day and
prompts you gently when you've not made
as many as you should have this daily
total varies from day to day to keep
things interesting but it is about
10,000 steps and i found the apps
analytics and prompting helps me to get
to this total keeping a diary is another
new year's resolution that people like
to try and of course in our smartphone
error we have apps like day one which is
one dollar on IRS to help with this task
this journaling app has a great
minimalist look and it easy to use
interface and it tries to automate as
much as the process as it can for you
for example by automatically tagging
your GPS location and the weather so
that every diary entry has a little bit
of context added to it diary entries can
include images and text of course and
overall it makes the task of keeping a
journal very easy and that's it for me
however happy new year and i'll see you
